name: queryNew
description: Creates a new query object. The query can be populated with data using functions queryAddRow, querySetCell, or by passing it in to the rowData argument.

params.name: columnList
params.description:
A string or a variable that contains one. Delimited list
 of column names, or an empty string.

params.name: columnTypeList
params.description: CF7+ Comma-delimited list specifying column data types.

params.name: rowData
params.description: CF10+ Data to populate the query. Can be a struct (with keys matching column names), an array of structs, or an array of arrays (in same order as columnList)

examples.title: Builds a simple query using queryNew
examples.description: Using Script with the queryAddRow querySetCell functions to populate the query.

examples.title: Builds a simple query using queryNew
examples.description: Using CFML Tags with the queryAddRow querySetCell functions to populate the query.
examples.code:
<cfset news = queryNew("id,title", "integer,varchar")>
<cfset queryAddRow(news)>
<cfset querySetCell(news, "id", "1")>
<cfset querySetCell(news, "title", "Dewey defeats Truman")>
<cfset queryAddRow(news)>
<cfset querySetCell(news, "id", "2")>
<cfset querySetCell(news, "title", "Men walk on Moon")>
<cfset writeDump(news)>

examples.title: Creating and Populating a query using an array rowData in queryNew
examples.description: CF10+ Passes an array of structs to create a new query.

examples.title: Creating and Populating a single row query using rowData in queryNew
examples.description: CF10+ If you only need one row you can pass a single struct instead of an array into the rowData argument.
